DataElement.preferredName: OMRS Oral Cavity Change Description Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that describes changes to the oral cavity due to pathological processes that are assessed using descriptive text.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A research tool used to assess inflammation in the mouth and classification of oral changes after bone marrow transplant and chronic graft versus host disease._The cavity lying at the upper end of the alimentary canal, bounded on the outside by the lips and inside by the oropharynx and containing in humans the tongue, gums, and teeth._The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character._Description; a statement that represents something in words.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A research tool used to assess inflammation in the mouth and classification of oral changes after bone marrow transplant and chronic graft versus host disease.

Concepts.definition: A research tool used to assess inflammation in the mouth and classification of oral changes after bone marrow transplant and chronic graft versus host disease.

Property.preferredDefinition: The cavity lying at the upper end of the alimentary canal, bounded on the outside by the lips and inside by the oropharynx and containing in humans the tongue, gums, and teeth.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.:Description; a statement that represents something in words.

Concepts.definition: The cavity located at the upper end of the alimentary canal, behind the teeth and gums that is bounded on the outside by the lips, above by the hard and soft palates and below by the tongue.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.
A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created and released for CCR per approval by P.Asangong. mc 3/5/12

ValueDomain.preferredName: Oral Mucositis Rating Scale Oral Cavity Change Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A research tool used to assess inflammation in the mouth and classification of oral changes after bone marrow transplant and chronic graft versus host disease._The cavity lying at the upper end of the alimentary canal, bounded on the outside by the lips and inside by the oropharynx and containing in humans the tongue, gums, and teeth._The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Ulceration; the process of ulcer formation; the process of becoming ulcerated.

Concepts.definition: The formation or development of an ulcer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Formation of membrane-like structures consisting of coagulated exudate that is loosely adherent to an inflamed tissue.

Concepts.definition: Formation of membrane-like structures consisting of coagulated exudate that is loosely adherent to an inflamed tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pathological transudate within one or more tissues.(FMA): Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.: An acute, spreading infection of the deep tissues of the skin and muscle that causes the skin to become warm and tender and may also cause fever, chills, swollen lymph nodes, and blisters.

Concepts.definition: Accumulation of an excessive amount of fluid in cells or intercellular tissues.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
Inflammation of the dermis and subcutaneous tissues caused by a bacterial infection. Symptoms include erythema, edema, and pain to the affected area.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having the characteristics of a chronic, recurrent, pruritic inflammatory disorder of unknown etiology that affects the skin and mucus membranes. It presents with rashes and papules that tend to resolve spontaneously. It may be associated with hepatitis C. Certain drugs that contain arsenic or bismuth are associated with reactions mimicking lichen planus.

Concepts.definition: Having the characteristics of a chronic, recurrent, pruritic inflammatory disorder of unknown etiology that affects the skin and mucus membranes. It presents with rashes and papules that tend to resolve spontaneously. It may be associated with hepatitis C. Certain drugs that contain arsenic or bismuth are associated with reactions mimicking lichen planus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hypertrophy of the outermost layer of the epidermis. It maybe caused by physical or chemical irritants, irradiation, infection, or neoplastic processes.

Concepts.definition: Hypertrophy of the outermost layer of the epidermis. It may be caused by physical or chemical irritants, irradiation, infection, or neoplastic processes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Redness of the skin produced by congestion of the capillaries. This condition may result from a variety of causes.

Concepts.definition: Red discoloration of the skin caused by infectious agents, inflammation, drug hypersensitivity, or underlying disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any weakening or degeneration, especially through lack of use.

Concepts.definition: Any weakening or degeneration, especially through lack of use.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
